review_title: Best company I've worked for in 20+ years
pros: They let their employees know they are appreciated. As a therapist I do not feel pressured to overcharge or see a patient for more minutes than they need to make a RUGs category. Management supports continuing education of their therapists.
cons: The physical environments of the hospital and especially of the attached nursing home Florence Hand are outdated. This site requires 20 words

pros: I had wonderful coworkers and loved meeting and caring for my patients. I always had the supplies I needed to care for them. That is taken for granted at other facilities. The schedule was doable, though 12 hour shifts are tough on anyone. Having a good team behind you helps. Now that the new organization has taken over the facility, I hope there will be great things in store for a community hospital in a high need area.
cons: The challenge of having a good team behind you is having a terrible manager and upper management that cause the good hard working employees to leave because they feel overworked, unappreciated, and undervalued. There was no praise or accolades, certainly no bonuses after the multimillion dollar addition. My manager made several promises she never kept, she prevented me from transferring to a different department so another less qualified staff member could have the position and I still feel betrayed.

review_title: WGHS, a GREAT place to work.
pros: The people and the sense of community are the best reasons to work here.  As is normal in healthcare, salaries go the the clinically astute personnel, but everyone here is treated like an integral part of this community.  Sure there are bad managers who treat employees poorly, but they are being discovered and rooted out.  A healthy hospital staff starts with a happy workforce, and WGHS is doing their honest best to make that a reality.
cons: The pay for non-clinical staff is less than ideal.  Some of the top ranges for my position are right around the starting figures at other companies.  Also, managers do not get merit increases, so there is little incentive for someone to want to move up to a management position.

review_title: Decent place to work for a small town.
pros: Decent pay and benefits for a small town.
cons: Politics as usual.  Upper management is not very receptive to ideas from the "commoners".  State of the art buildings cost in the millions and not quite sure how this hospital can have enough revenue to keep it up.

pros: Awesome place to work.  Very satisfying, and a great company.
cons: Very stressful work environment.  12 hours mostly on your feet.  Huge decision making.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Lagrange, GA
pros: Great people to work with, team spirit, and team players
cons: There always someone trying to be the boss when there is already a boss. Should pay more for what all the work we do

pros: You make new friends and meet people from all walks of life.
cons: Being a PRN and not knowing when and if your job will end with no benefits.

pros: The people that work there are great.
Convenient work hours and flexible schedule
cons: Not enough pay for the work I was doing

pros: Can't think of one good thing to say about this Laboratory!
cons: The worst Laboratory I have ever worked for!  Very messy!
